intro: Cryptandra ciliata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white or cream-colored flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Cryptandra ciliata is often found in shrublands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
